Instance.description:
When tuned and called, return an element that will request the animation corresponding to a particular series of ASM states.
Do not use this in tunings directly, use the TunableAnimationReference which will provide the tunable factory as well as the ability to override parameters in asm calling.
Example:
INSTANCE_TUNABLES = {'my_animation': TunableAnimationReference()} ... self.do(self.affordance.my_animations(self))

TunableTuple.name: _overrides
TunableTuple.description: Overrides are for expert-level configuration of Animation Elements. In 95% of cases, the animation element will work perfectly with no overrides. Overrides allow us to customize animations further using things like vfx changes and also to account for some edge cases.

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_chance
Tunable.description: The chance that the balloon will play.

TunableList.name: balloon_choices
TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableTuple.description: A variant of either a single icon or a category of icons. Optionally, test whether this element should be available.

TunableTuple.name: balloon_icon
TunableTuple.description: The tuning for the actual balloon icon.

TunableEnum.name: balloon_type
TunableEnum.description: The visual style of the balloon background. For example if it is a speech balloon or a thought balloon.

TunableVariant.name: category_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled balloon will display an additional category icon.

TunableVariant.name: show_category_icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: debug_overlay_override
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon in debug, if present. This overlay will be placed on the balloon instead of overlay in debug only.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: overlay
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon, if present.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to assign to this balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite.
If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override.
If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override.
If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: There is an arbitrary number of possible animation selectors, based on participation in group.

TunableList.name: groups
TunableList.description: A list of difficulty to animation mappings.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableList.name: required_slots
TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.name: sounds
TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_sound
TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description:
Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty.
For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: random_in_circle
TunableTuple.description: Specify a random offset within given full/partial circle/donut.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The slice of the donut/circle in degrees.

TunableVariant.name: axis
TunableVariant.description: Around which axis the position will be located.

TunableTuple.name: distance
TunableTuple.description: The distance range relative to origin point that the generated point should be in.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description: An offset (rotation) in degrees, affecting where the start of the angle is. This has no effect if angle is 360 degrees.

TunableList.name: group
TunableList.description: The group the Sim must be a participant of

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_chance
Tunable.description: The chance that the balloon will play.

TunableList.name: balloon_choices
TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableTuple.description: A variant of either a single icon or a category of icons. Optionally, test whether this element should be available.

TunableTuple.name: balloon_icon
TunableTuple.description: The tuning for the actual balloon icon.

TunableEnum.name: balloon_type
TunableEnum.description: The visual style of the balloon background. For example if it is a speech balloon or a thought balloon.

TunableVariant.name: category_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled balloon will display an additional category icon.

TunableVariant.name: show_category_icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: debug_overlay_override
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon in debug, if present. This overlay will be placed on the balloon instead of overlay in debug only.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: overlay
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon, if present.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to assign to this balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite.
If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override.
If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override.
If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableList.name: required_slots
TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.name: sounds
TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_sound
TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description:
Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty.
For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: random_in_circle
TunableTuple.description: Specify a random offset within given full/partial circle/donut.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The slice of the donut/circle in degrees.

TunableVariant.name: axis
TunableVariant.description: Around which axis the position will be located.

TunableTuple.name: distance
TunableTuple.description: The distance range relative to origin point that the generated point should be in.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description: An offset (rotation) in degrees, affecting where the start of the angle is. This has no effect if angle is 360 degrees.

TunableList.name: required_slots
TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.name: sounds
TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_sound
TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description:
Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty.
For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: random_in_circle
TunableTuple.description: Specify a random offset within given full/partial circle/donut.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The slice of the donut/circle in degrees.

TunableVariant.name: axis
TunableVariant.description: Around which axis the position will be located.

TunableTuple.name: distance
TunableTuple.description: The distance range relative to origin point that the generated point should be in.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description: An offset (rotation) in degrees, affecting where the start of the angle is. This has no effect if angle is 360 degrees.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor Name is the name of the main actor for this animation. In almost every case this will just be 'x', so please be absolutely sure you know what you're doing when changing this value.

Tunable.name: asm_key
Tunable.description: ASM Key is the Animation State Machine to use for this animation. You are selecting from the ASMs that are in your Assets/InGame/Statemachines folder, and several of the subsequent fields are populated by information from this selection.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
If enabled this allows you to tune which actor is the base object by name. This is important if the posture target is not the same as the target of the interaction.
For example: The massage table has massage interactions that target the other Sim but the massage therapist must route and stand at the massage table. In this case you would need to enable base_object_name and tune it to the name of the actor you want to target with the posture, or in this case massageTable. This is tuned in massageTable_SocialInteractions.

TunableList.name: begin_states
TunableList.description: A list of states in the ASM to run through at the beginning of this element. Generally-speaking, you should always use begin_states for all your state requests. The only time you would need end_states is when you are making a staging-SuperInteraction. In that case, the content in begin_states happens when the SI first runs, before it stages, and the content in end_states will happen as the SI is exiting. When in doubt, put all of your state requests here.

Tunable.name: carry_target_name
Tunable.description: Carry Target Name is the actor name of the carried object in this ASM. This is only relevant if the Target and Carry Target are different.

Tunable.name: create_target_name
Tunable.description: Create Target Name is the actor name of an object that will be created by this interaction. This is used frequently in the crafting system but rarely elsewhere. If your interaction creates an object in the Sim's hand, use this.

TunableList.name: end_states
TunableList.description: A list of states to run through at the end of this element. This should generally be one of two values: * empty (default), which means to do no requests. This is best if you don't know what to use here, as auto-exit behavior, which automatically requests the 'exit' state on any ASM that is still active, should handle most cases for you. Note: this is not safe for elements that are used as the staging content for SIs! See below! * 'exit', which requests the content on the way out of the statemachine. This is important to set for SuperInteractions that are set to use staging basic content, as auto-exit behavior is disabled in that case. This means the content on the way to exit will be requested as the SI is finishing. You can put additional state requests here if the ASM is more complex, but that is very rare.

TunableVariant.name: initial_state
TunableVariant.description: The name of the initial state in the ASM to use when begin_states are requested. If this is untuned, which should be the case almost all the time, it will use the default initial state of 'entry'. Ask your animation partner if you think you want to tune this because you should not have to and it is probably best to just change the structure of the ASM. Remember that ASMs are re-used within a single interaction, so if you are defining an outcome animation, you can rely on the state to persist from the basic content.

Tunable.name: repeat
Tunable.description:
If this is checked, then the begin_states will loop until the controlling sequence (e.g. the interaction) ends. At that point, end_states will play.
This tunable allows you to create looping one-shot states. The effects of this tunable on already looping states is undefined.
This changes the interpretation of thought balloons. We will trigger one balloon per loop of the animation. The delay on the balloon is relative to the start of each loop rather than the start of the entire sequence.

Tunable.name: target_name
Tunable.description: This determines which actor the target of the interaction will be. In general, this should be the object that will be clicked on to create interactions that use this content. This helps the posture system understand what objects you already know about and which to search for. Sit says its target name is sitTemplate, which means you have to sit in the chair that was clicked on, whereas Eat says its target name is consumable, which means you can sit in any chair in the world to eat. This ends up in the var_map in the runtime.
